bioghist.p: Theophil (Ted) Aprill was born in Ann Arbor and is a life long member of Zion Lutheran Church. He served in the Navy during World War II and upon return from the war received his Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering. He went on to own and operate Allied and A&L Parts, an automotive parts supplier based in Washtenaw County.

Aprill was actively involved in Zion Lutheran Church throughout his life. He ushered at church services for over 35 years and served on numerous Church committees and boards. He served on the Church Life Board and the Worship and Spiritual Life Board in the 1970s, and acted as the chairman of the Centennial Task Force in 1975. He served for several years on both the Executive Board and the Church Council, the latter as Vice President for one year. His service on the Executive Board coincides with a major conflict in the Church, ostensibly centering on the music program, but encompassing larger matters about the style of leadership and worship desired by the congregation, and the fiscal responsibility of the Church.

scopecontent.p: The Theophil Aprill collection contains two series relating to his activities with Zion Lutheran Church in Ann Arbor, Michigan. These series are Zion History and the Conflict at Zion.

The Zion History series documents Ted Aprill's participation in Zion Lutheran Church and constitutes the bulk of the collection. This contains annual reports, Church bulletins, correspondence, clippings, meeting minutes, sermons, and information on the Zion Retirement Center, a Lutheran Retirement Center in Washtenaw County and associated with the Church. The material in this series is organized chronologically by decade.

scopecontent.p: The Conflict at Zion series contains correspondence, reports, and clippings related to a major conflict that occurred at Zion during the 1990s. Modernization and budgetary needs of the music program and a conflict over the leadership and business style of Pastor Dan Johns were at the heart of this conflict, however the tensions and surrounding these issues affected the congregation as a whole, as well as other administrative aspects of the Church. This conflict ultimately led to a number of congregants and staff members leaving the Church and to a lengthy conflict resolution and reconciliation process.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: These papers augment the Bentley Historical Library's rich holdings documenting the religious history of Southeast Michigan. Researchers interested in the history of Ann Arbor's Zion Lutheran Church should also consult the Zion Lutheran Church records, 1833-1981. This collection contains church history, administrative and financial records, and the papers of church organizations and individual papers. The Bentley Historical Library also holds the records of the Lutheran Church in America, Michigan Synod Records and a number of publications related to Zion Lutheran Church.
